Detailed Description

This is the scene displayed on application entry (when CAN-FD-HS app is selected from flipper main menu).

enum UsbCanItem

identifier of the item list element (i.e Application mode : USB-CAN-BRIDGE, USB LOOPBACK TEST,TEST CAN) selected by the user and communicated to CONTROLLER via usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback

< identifier (1) corresponding to USB LOOPBACK TEST item < identifier (2) corresponding to TESt CAN TEST item

Definition at line 17 of file usbCan_scene_start.cpp.

Function Documentation

◆ usb_can_scene_start_on_enter()

void usb_can_scene_start_on_enter ( void *  context)

This function is called via usb_can_app_alloc() at app start and via other scenes basically when back key is pressed. It will display main menu items which correspond to application mode (USB-CAN-BRIDGE, USB LOOPBACK TEST,TEST CAN).

This function perform the following actions:

  1. set usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback callback when an item list is selected via variable_item_list_set_enter_callback
  2. add list item in this order : "USB-CAN Bridge" (0) ,"TEST USB LOOPBACK" (1), "TEST CAN" (2). This is important because it must correspond to UsbCanItem.
  3. enable power via USB through furi_hal_power_enable_otg() since we can consider flipper is probably connected to USB.
  4. set pre-selected list item (highlight). It shall be :
    • last pre-selected list item if this scene is re-entered
    • USB-CAN-BRIDGE item if the scene is entered for the first time (initial state)
  5. request content described above to be displayed via view_dispatcher_switch_to_view()

Definition at line 60 of file usbCan_scene_start.cpp.

◆ usb_can_scene_start_on_event()

bool usb_can_scene_start_on_event ( void *  context,
SceneManagerEvent  event 
)

This function is trigged by usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback(). This will try to run SCENE-USB-CAN if USB Link is avilable, SCENE-ERROR-DIALOG otherwise.

This function is trigged by usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback() which send an event through scene_manager

  1. check event is expected (sent by usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback : UsbCanCustomEventTestCan, UsbCanCustomEventTestUsb or UsbCanCustomEventUsbCan)
  2. check usb is available through furi_hal_usb_is_locked()
    • if USB is available, go to SCENE-USB-CAN in order to run USB and CAN ling ( MODEL )
    • Otherwise it will run SCENE-ERROR-DIALOG

Definition at line 87 of file usbCan_scene_start.cpp.

◆ usb_can_scene_start_on_exit()

void usb_can_scene_start_on_exit ( void *  context)

This function is called when back key is pressed. It will call variable_item_list_reset.

Definition at line 110 of file usbCan_scene_start.cpp.

◆ usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback()

static void usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback ( void *  context,
uint32_t  index 
)
static

Function called when an application mode is entered : this will communicate mode to be entered to MODEL before trying to switch to SCENE-USB-CAN via usb_can_scene_start_on_event().

Function called when a list item is selected. This was registered in usb_can_scene_start_on_enter(). This function does the fololowing actions:

  1. save selected item via usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback to be pre-selected on next SCENE-START entry
  2. Communicate mode to be entered to MODEL via usb_can_scene_set_state()
  3. Try to switch to SCENE-USB-CAN by sending a signal (event) to trig usb_can_scene_start_on_event()

Definition at line 30 of file usbCan_scene_start.cpp.
